Jargon Term: You had a small collection of blood around your heart because of a perforation during the pacemaker insertion, but it is now resolved.
Annotation: Medical Issues - Complication developed in the hospital

Jargon Term: Do not take a shower until after your check up at the device clinic on [**7-7**]. Please keep the dressing clean and dry. You may take a bath, but please keep the dressing dry.
Annotation: Aftercare instructions - patient needs to do - Other

Jargon Term: Please avoid extreme movements with you left arm such as tucking your shirt in or reaching to lift something. Do not lift more than 5 pounds for one week.
Annotation: Aftercare instructions - patient needs to do - Other

Jargon Term: You developed a drug rash to Keflex, therefore you should not take this antibiotic or any other cephalosporin or penicillin as you probably are allergic to them.
Annotation: Aftercare instructions - patient needs to do - Other

Jargon Term: Please keep all of your follow-up appts.
Annotation: Aftercare instructions - Upcoming Schedules - Specialist appointment

Jargon Term: Make sure you drink plenty of water or juice when you get home.
Annotation: Aftercare instructions - patient needs to do - Diet

Jargon Term: Please call Dr. [**Last Name (STitle) 98155**] or Dr. [**Last Name (STitle) **] you have any weakness, fevers, trouble breathing, fainting, blood in your stools, increased coughing, vomiting or pain in your chest.
Please call the device clinic if your chest area around the pacemaker becomes more sore or red.
Annotation: Aftercare instructions - patient needs to do - Other
